definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: This shows the counteracting property of network security.
sentences.chinese: 這體現了網絡安全的攻防對抗本質。

sentences.english: In his view, Posey is still learning the team's offensive and defensive tactics.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲，波西還在學習球隊的攻防戰術。

sentences.english: Our military must understand it correctly, and then do well in the offensive and defensive battle of core value.
sentences.chinese: 我軍必須正確認識，打好核心價值的攻防戰。

sentences.english: Havlicek was one of the most all-around players at both ends of the court.
sentences.chinese: 哈夫利切克是攻防兩端最全面的球員之一。

sentences.english: Strong Scottish melee unit armed with sword and shield and wearing plate armour.
sentences.chinese: 貴族劍士身穿板甲，手持長劍和盾牌，攻防能力俱佳。

sentences.english: They teach the game at such a deeper level than X 's and O's .
sentences.chinese: 他們教會我更深層次的比賽，而不只是簡單的攻防。

sentences.english: Is a comprehensive offensive and defensive players.
sentences.chinese: 是一個攻防兼備的綜合性選手。

sentences.english: They're a good team, well-organised and Milan will have to be very careful.
sentences.chinese: 巴勒莫是一支攻防有序的強隊，米蘭得小心了。

sentences.english: Aircraft carrier fleet has diversiform campaign abilities for attack and defense.
sentences.chinese: 航母編隊具有攻防兼備的多種作戰能力。

sentences.english: These three excellent players structured an iron delta in the midfield.
sentences.chinese: 這三名優秀的球員在中場形成了鐵三角式的攻防體系。

sentences.english: The most important one is the technology of attack and defense.
sentences.chinese: 解構性技術，其中最主要的就是攻防對抗技術。

sentences.english: Professor of offensive and defensive techniques of experimental classes and control classes to simplify professor of Shaolin boxing.
sentences.chinese: 實驗班教授攻防技法，對照班教授簡化少林拳。

sentences.english: Politics is just a show to the old guards to both sides.
sentences.chinese: 政治只是雙方攻防戰老把戲而已。

sentences.english: Howard was a monster on both ends of the floor during his prime.
sentences.chinese: 在他的巔峯霍華德攻防兩端都是頭猛獸。

definition: both ends (of a stick etc)/two extremes
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to play (a card)/to make a move in a game
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
(of a team) to throw oneself into the battle
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
